H0.text: by 1914 which of the following african countries were still independent. Ethiopia

H1.text: by 1914 which of the following african countries were still independent. Morocco

H2.text: by 1914 which of the following african countries were still independent. Egypt

H3.text: by 1914 which of the following african countries were still independent. Liberia

A6.text: Ethiopia was never colonized, but endured an Italian occupation from 1936 to 1941.

A7.text: Liberia declared independence on July 26, 1847, which the U.S. did not recognize until February 5, 1862.

A8.text: In 1914, Egypt was still part of the Ottoman Empire, with Khedive Abbas II supporting the Ottoman side in World War I.

A9.text: Egypt was formally declared independent from the Ottoman Empire in 1922, remaining under British protection.

A10.text: In 1912, the Treaty of Fez made Morocco a protectorate of France, and triggered the 1912 Fez riots.

A11.text: Morocco regained its independence and reunified in 1956.
